name: Dogs in Books Online Quiz | Specific Subjects & Themes | 10 Questions

questions.text: Albert Payson Terhune was famous for his collie stories. Who was his most famous collie hero?
questions.explanation:
Lad.

	He wrote 'Lad, A Dog' and other books. Very anthropomorphic but fun to read!

questions.text: This mixed-breed dog was the hero of a book (named after the dog) that was contemporary to 'Black Beauty' and, like it, crusaded against cruelty to animals.
questions.explanation:
Beautiful Joe.

	'Beautiful Joe' was in reality an ugly mutt. His ears and tail were hacked off as a puppy.

questions.text: John Steinbeck wrote a book about driving cross-country with his Standard Poodle named...
questions.explanation:
Charley.

	'Travels with Charley' was the book.

questions.text: This award-winning book was in part about an African-American boy's fight to save his father's injured coon dog.
questions.explanation:
Sounder.

	This is a very popular children's novel exploring issues of racism in the South.

questions.text: 'The Call of the Wild' by Jack London recounted the story of a mixed-breed sled dog named
questions.explanation:
Buck.

	Buck is often represented as a St. Bernard, but he was a mixed breed.

questions.text: Virginia Woolf wrote a humorous 'biography' of Elizabeth Barrett-Browning's dog...
questions.explanation:
Flush.

	Flush was a spoiled English Cocker Spaniel.

questions.text: The little-known book 'The Starlight Barking' by Dodie Smith is the sequel to her better-known...
questions.explanation:
101 Dalmatians.

	Luckily, Disney never touched this one.

questions.text: John Muir wrote a book about his dog...
questions.explanation:
Stickeen.

	Stickeen accompanied him on many a Sierran hike.

questions.text: Eric Knight authored the classic story of a dog's love for her boy-
questions.explanation:
Lassie Come-Home.

	Although sold and sent away, Lassie managed to come home.

questions.text: Beverly Cleary's books about Henry and Ramona also featured a dog named...
questions.explanation:
Ribsy.

	Ribsy was just your average neighborhood mutt.
